website_summaries.verdict: The Brother QL-810W label maker prints a wide variety of high-quality label types from your PC or mobile device, but its higher-end sibling provides significantly more features and versatility for just a little more money.
pros: Great print software and robust mobile app
cons: Ability to print in red limited to one label type
QL-820NWB offers much more for not a lot more money

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY, ITS OLD TECH!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had an absolute nightmare trying to get this to work, the website offers Windows 10 drivers but these do not work. Searched online and people are saying you need to update the firmware in Windows 7 for it to work with Windows 10 (I'm on 1809 update). Tried this and there was no firmware available. It also didn't work in Windows 7 as the label software it comes with is utter trash. The free paper roll provided was 62x8 but there was no such paper size option in the program. Do yourself a favor and buy another up-to-date product. Dymo are superior and actually work.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Never faff about with inkjet Avery labels again. Bargain!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny, as I never again have to faff about with A4 Avery labels in the inkjet printer. The printer comes with two starter rolls to get you going. The software it comes with is great, as it is divided into ‘basic’ and ‘advanced’ tabs. So you can rattle off a basic address label super quick, or drop into ‘advanced’ mode, and create everything from a drawer label with graphics, to a 1 metre long banner with huge text. Print quality is good. Print speed is fast, and the V shaped cutter is ultra reliable. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: G. Laws

customer_reviews.title: very good but very expensive
customer_reviews.text: it is very nice product but it is very expesive . so if you go qulity yeah thats it
customer_reviews.author: Raja

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected costs
customer_reviews.text: Well I was well impressed with the look of the product and the price at the time of purchase was reasonable. Alas when it came to downloading the driver for the printer I was shocked to find that because I had an extra security system on my PC it would cost an additional £69.99 to install the driver. I was told that if I did not have one of the security systems removed then the printer could not be installed. Any further interested party's should think hard before buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gareth Jaxon

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Label Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent label printer at a reasonable price. The software was very easy to install and the printer produced first class printed labels. Very strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tom P

customer_reviews.title: An affordable, easy to use label printer
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Brother label printer. Fortunately, I saved all my addresses and contacts from the time I was using my original Brother label printer. This made life so much easier as I am now able to turn on the new software, find my list of labels and print them without any hassles. When I want to have something printed in red all I had to do was highlight the section of text and change the colour. The software however, did remind me that I was still in monochrome mode, so I just had to change that and print. Very intuitive and user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred O'Coyle

customer_reviews.title: Print for England!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs . No more to be said.. Can I just add, if anyone has a problem with this printer and you have any difficulty with set up etc, contact Brother Help and ask for James Leigh, he is the person to talk to.....
customer_reviews.author: Mr. JA Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Good value and versatile printer for labels only.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent piece of kit. I needed a printer which made it simple to print individual labels which were clear and easily readable. I previously used sheets of labels with a standard inkjet printer. This was fine when I needed numerous labels printed but was wasteful if I didn't use the entire sheet. It is not a good idea to put a label sheet through a printer more than once as the adhesive can catch on the printer internals and jam the printer. This printer does what I need and more - I am still discovering what it can do! Good value, easy to use and very versatile.
customer_reviews.author: Winston Woolf

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK ON WINDOWS 10
customer_reviews.text: I’ve wasted the last 5 hours trying to install this! Tried everything! Very frustrating! Udate: After 2 days trying to install, I eventually got there. In case it helps anyone else; I went in to the Windows control panel - devices and printers - then removed the QL-700. I then plugged the printer back in again and it installed properly that time. I noticed also that the green Editor Lite needs to be off before it prints. Now that I have the printer working, I really love it! Very simple to use and very quick. I've deducted 2 stars though for each day lost trying to install the bloody thing!
customer_reviews.author: Paranoid Hippy

customer_reviews.title: Brother QL-700 Label Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have always had 2nd hand label printers but the ones that I have would not work on Linux, Dymo 320 I hunted round for one for ages and then saw this for sale on Amazon. Then I looked at the video's on YouTube and now I have one. It is absolutely brilliant. The software installation on the Windows PC was so easy. Not tried Linux yet, got to build my machine but it says it will work with Linux.... If its half as good with Linux then it will be brilliant
customer_reviews.author: Mr. James M. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Seller doesn’t package items!
customer_reviews.text: Shocking that the seller sent this item without any wrapping on it whatspever! The label was slapped right onto the box (which wasn’t even sealed with tape) and it was left in my porch! Very insecure. Luckily it was all ok inside and all parts there. It was however heavily discounted - so great value for money. The printer itself took a VERY long time for me to try and set up on a MacBook Air - my husband interjected in the end and got it working quickly - so maybe it was just me being dumb. The labels it prints are perfect though.. can’t fault the machine. Smaller than I thought it would be too.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Evans

customer_reviews.title: It's OK. For simple fixed size labels only
customer_reviews.text: Glad to have one. Not hugely impressed with it. If all you need to do is to knock out the same label time and time again you'll find this a brilliant bit of kit. If you have ambition to be more 'creative' than you will not find much flexibility here. Graphics are poor. Labels - when guillotined to a desired size are almost impossible to remove from the backing - could have done with a lateral separation cut. Software is clunky - but you do get a good level of WYSIWYG.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Great printer and easy to configure - works great with FBA labels too
customer_reviews.text: At first it requires a bit of playing around, but generally it's easy to use and the Wi-Fi printing was straight forward. I like the option of cutting after each label or at the end of the printing job or not at all, plus manual cutting with a press of the button. Each option can be useful in a different situation. I like that it supports continuous printing, so long labels can be created with the right tape, or one can use manufacturer set label sizes. Perfect for Amazon and a bit better than Dymo in many ways.
customer_reviews.author: Kamil KW of OSUK

customer_reviews.title: really usefull and eas to use
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed i have always thought about investing in one and having tried other methods ( printing and cutting and sticking labels or direct printing labels ) Where this excells is if you just need one great if you need 100 great . Saves time Looks sharper cleaner Easy to use Plus onnce it loaded up there no shearching for sheets of labels no ink to replace just plug it in create your labels print and stick . Where as the sheets well we all know the story . I got 3 years cover from brother for free as well by going to site and logging the purchase i made
customer_reviews.author: David S Mcdonald

customer_reviews.title: Wireless? Not so much.
customer_reviews.text: Reviews had said that getting the wireless connection was problematic so I set it up on the kitchen table and it worked first time. It was idiot proof. I then moved it to its proper location and it never printed wirelessly again - despite hours of fiddling . It’s a good enough printer but to describe it as wireless is playing a little fast and loose with the term.
customer_reviews.author: Mr L C JOHNSTON

customer_reviews.title: Hard to install and its not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Its alright. I mean after a few attempts and hours reading the "not very explanatory" manual and instructions even after downloading several softwares that is required...yeah you are able to print so.e labels. But be sure you will be spending quite a few good hours trying to set the whole thing everytime you try to print. You can print from your mobile but I was unable to connect with my blutetooth.instead I had to connect to my laptop bluetooth and then use it to print to the labeller
customer_reviews.author: Mary Jo

customer_reviews.title: Useless without online support!
customer_reviews.text: Have had this label printer about 6 month now & no online support, still can't print a label eventhough everything is now set up. Have now bought a disk player & everything from the cd loaded & printer works great for all my labels.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Towler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: This is brilliant. Bought for my personal use and I could not be more pleased. The software takes a bit of studying and seems a bit old fashioned but I am getting there. I printed all of my Christmas card labels and they looked beautiful. A very useful addition to my digital equipment.
customer_reviews.author: B. V. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work with Royal Mail click and send
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is, I bought it to print royal Mail postage labels and I have as yet not found a way for it to communicate with the online app or to print the labels in the right dimensions even though it is apparently capable of doing so
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Ross

customer_reviews.title: Have spent hours wasted on trying to set this up and nothing
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for me, tried it on desktop and laptop and same communication errors kept showing up. Emailed Brother support and got nothing back. Have spent hours wasted on trying to set this up and nothing. I am requesting a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy B

customer_reviews.title: Might be the best printer out there.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up, high quality of printing, there is equivalent to official labels of the same quality (though only black, I've seen no unofficial black and red labels yet). It works perfectly through WiFi and Windows 10, and official free app is quite useful. The only disadvantage comparing to Dymo is lack of API, but it's a non-issue for most customers. So far I am very pleased with this printer.
customer_reviews.author: D. K.

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great label printer that does everything I need (I did NOT need the wireless connectivity offered by other models in the range). Being able to print in red as well as black is a nice touch and I use it often but, and this is where it drops a star, the black can have a red fringe to it when using the bi-colour paper. In the main: very pleased with it .
customer_reviews.author: amhipperson

customer_reviews.title: Not good with Mac’s
customer_reviews.text: As a Mac user this machine was pretty useless - most of the features described are not available on a Mac and it’s severely restricted. Eg you cannot print from Microsoft Office software, so you have to enter an address directly into the Brother softaware which is very limited. Installation was very confusing and not at all intuitive (and I work in IT!) I have returned this machine and ordered a Dymo as it specifically states Mac integration and seems to better all round, albeit more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Pelican

customer_reviews.title: Quick wireless connection
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the printer I wanted. The previous Brother label printer was excellent too but it wouldn’t work on my Mac but this one is excellent as it’s wireless. Already coming handy and it’s iPhone app is easy to use as well. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mehvish M.

customer_reviews.title: Best label printer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a different manufacturer's label printer and was relatively satisfied with it. That was until it broke. The flimsy lever on one side of the printer bent and that was that. After hunting around for the same company's products, I decided to investigate other offerings. Not only is the Brother a far more sturdy and better constructed label printer; its software is so much more versatile and enables me to create professional and complex labels. Finally, the range of labels and label materials makes the Brother a star compared with the others on the market.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Griffiths

customer_reviews.title: this will drive you mad
customer_reviews.text: set up is a pain as others have said but what drives you mad is how many paper size options and you need match that with the label template. then it will not print if its the wrong type of paper and you get a few in the box ie colour or mono even though colour is just red. HUGE TIP get a label printer that is easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Dave in glasgow

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so i could Use it to print of stickers for my product. I love It! It’s really easy & simple to use and it prints off stickers so quickly! It prints off in black & red, but for that you need buy different paper. It comes with the address labels (black ink) and another bigger roll for printing in black & red. I would be careful when printing off small/ bold font though, as it tends to come out a bit blurry. But other wise it’s amazing, love it!
customer_reviews.author: Lalita

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Print Black and Red
customer_reviews.text: The labels designed for printing Black and Red don't work. The black text comes out as burgundy the red is OK. I spoke to their 2nd level technical team who confirmed this as known issue that has been previously escalated. As this is known and they still misrepresent the features I gave 1 star. Buy QL-700 if you don't need red.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great with iPad
customer_reviews.text: I needed to buy this for it's network connectivity because I have decided to replace my laptop with an iPad. It works great with the free software available from Brother. It even does red as well as black when used with the correct type of label.
customer_reviews.author: Nottsdaz

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant hardware and printing, some issues with software
customer_reviews.text: Extremely great piece of kit that does exactly what we wanted and is easily adjustable to switch up labels as needed. Very speedy print and perfect cut each time. Only thing that holds it back from 5* is the software is quite buggy in that in a perfectly capable laptop that runs a variety of rather demanding pieces of software very fluidly, for some reason, the Brother software is incredibly slow - changing a single character in a pre-existing label can take 5 seconds, easily, to do. Very frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Matt Murray

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says it does
customer_reviews.text: Initially bought this to print bar coide labels but found out this printer will do much, much more. ad hoc addresses, badges, gudance labels for goods we sell. The process is quick and easy although I needed to take some time to figure out the software. Printed items arrive very quickly and are pre cut . All in all this printer does more than I expected and at a very high quality. Down side: the only issue I have is that the printer switches off after a period and has to be manually restarted if you want to print anything. This minor issue is however easily negated by the positive bits. Would I buy again? Most certainly.
customer_reviews.author: ColinsWatches com

customer_reviews.title: Good label printer
customer_reviews.text: It took a bit to download software for pc but the app on phone works good over all very good kit
customer_reviews.author: Johnny5z

customer_reviews.title: A software refresh, please!
customer_reviews.text: What is is with label printing software where the UI looks like a relic of the late 1990s. It is awful. Installation too is very clunky ... Seems to be a lot of bloatware which serves little purpose. I just with effort would be made to modernise the offering.
customer_reviews.author: rb2902

customer_reviews.title: Don't believe the advertising blurb
customer_reviews.text: Installing the printer driver on a Mac was exceedingly difficult and getting the graphic package to work is impossible. The available documentation is dated 2011 and the driver is designed for iOS 5 way-away from the current version. Prints labels well but not the full package.
customer_reviews.author: eadejm

customer_reviews.title: Brother QL  700 label printer
customer_reviews.text: Was very easy to set up with the disc and instructions supplied. Even cuts the labels for you as you print them. Labels rolls are very easy to load and the software supplied automatically picks up the size. So very happy and for the price it's a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Good Label Printer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for my QL500 as I wanted to be able to share the label printer over Wi-Fi so it could be used from phones and other computers. The QL-810W works a treat. It is quick, automatically cuts the labels, can be accessed over Wi-Fi and I can use all the existing label templates I had for the QL500. Do check around for pricing as it can vary significantly. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: AndyW

customer_reviews.title: Now I have it working I am delighted
customer_reviews.text: This took me a while to set up, but more down to user error than anything else. Now I have it working I am delighted
customer_reviews.author: VB

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and versatile
customer_reviews.text: Very useful . But can be very costly to use. The variety of consumerbles are wide. Remember that you can't do everything with one size of paper rolls. Having said that, when you consider that the machine is extremely versatile then you will be pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lord Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Brother QL-800 printer
customer_reviews.text: I have the older QL-500, The QL-800 is a better printer all over in addition it cuts the labels when you finished your label. A bonus if you have older labels ie the DK ones you can use these in the QL-800 well done Brother
customer_reviews.author: R. Willey

customer_reviews.title: Good machine and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for doing eBay shipping labels- excellent, easy to use and set up. Initially finding the right label format on the software took a bit of time but once template was saved down it is great and makes life a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Mike burton

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Installing is a bit convoluted, but Brother is simply old school. After that it works flawlessly in every respect.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Stojic

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: Now I have it up and working, it is great and saves a lot of time writing out addresses. I have a Mac and found it not so much difficult but frustrating to set up
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Cooper

customer_reviews.title: It does what it says
customer_reviews.text: I needed a label printer, and with this model is very easy to create and print, and the refills are so easy to change, plus you can use it till the end. Moved from a Leitz label printer ( it was good but was breaking around 1 year ), hopefully this Brother will last longer..
customer_reviews.author: Andrei Popovici

customer_reviews.title: Great label thermal printer.
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend was looking for a thermal printer that she could use easily, she bought a cheap one but had to return it because we couldn't get it to install, I did some research and came across this Brother Ql-700, best thing was so easy to install, also so easy to use with a great range of label's to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: K1 Highly Recommended this Product
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended. Easy to use with phone app. We are using this printer with our repair pos and book in label. Easy to instal and connect to WiFi. Good quality and fast print.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin |Raza

customer_reviews.title: Not directly mains powered
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the older model I had which used 240 volt mainsthis printer comes with a large transformer not shown in the pictures so addditional cables and mess.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Welland

customer_reviews.title: Better for home Office situatio. than for busy commercial area.
customer_reviews.text: All is good with this printer. It is fast accurate, and produces clear and smudge-free labels. New blank labels are a bit expensive for large mailings; otherwise, all is good.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Reid

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for 7 weeks now to make sure it lasts and I can honestly say it’s a great little label printer!! Helped with soap and jar labels around house!
customer_reviews.author: ClaireSkiv

customer_reviews.title: Instinctive and easy to use - Working in less than 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, and producing labels within five minutes. Helps to have some understanding of DTP or design, but simple to pick up. Produces a crisp clear print down to 6pt. Ideal for Address Labels, Projects and Folder marking.
customer_reviews.author: Pmv Cornish

customer_reviews.title: Very Difficult to set up & use
customer_reviews.text: Hate it. Very complicated to use, and difficult to set up. Kept telling me it was the wrong driver. Followed the instructions. This is NOT plug & play. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: C. Reardon

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Good printer works great I think however if I had the option I would have chosen Wi-Fi variant but still dose a great job
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clever label printer.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. No printer ink needed and rolls of stickers are very good value. Run a business from home and this little printer is always going. Software installed easy and very simple to use. What’s not to like.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Only had it a short while but it seems very proficient at printing address labels and very hassle free (as you don’t have to mess around with toner or ribbon). Software takes a bit of getting used to, however once you understand it it’s fine.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Decent, works with a Python package called brother-ql and has a web based interface available called brother-ql-web. Make sure you shop around as this (or a similar model) is often discounted.
customer_reviews.author: Hobnob

customer_reviews.title: Very good fast & quiet label printer
customer_reviews.text: Nice & quiet label printer. Note: it only comes with the lite software. It requires a SW download & special labels in order to print in two colours. Otherwise more than happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great label printer, better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Great, better than expected, printing loads of good labels now A+++++++++++
customer_reviews.author: Guern

customer_reviews.title: Once set up
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my wife to print labels off for her ebay business. Haven't really experimented much with other things it can do. My wife copies and pastes addresses onto a template label in the software. Prints within a second. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: marion ogilvie

customer_reviews.title: Very good value for money
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and install, good printing quality, super convenient!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Great once setup
customer_reviews.text: Great product. The setup took forever to figure out but once it was sorted, it is easy to use everytime. Replacement labels are cheap on amazon too.
customer_reviews.author: James. B

customer_reviews.title: Easy label printing
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a home printer for address labels. This is it. It was easy to install and use (I don't think it does anything fancy, but that's not what I wanted it for. Print quality is poor. I would have expected more from Brother.
customer_reviews.author: M Bubble

customer_reviews.title: Nice product good value
customer_reviews.text: I’ve got windows 10 but I had to contact the manufacturer to finally get the software installed, they were really helpful, the printer itself is fantastic & works well on Bluetooth
customer_reviews.author: M J DUFFY

customer_reviews.title: Good quality printing and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is ideal for printing bar codes/prices for my shop. I should be able to get around 600 - 700 bar code labels from one roll which is very cost effective, especially if you use compatible rolls instead of genuine Brother label rolls.
customer_reviews.author: kaiyaq

customer_reviews.title: Labels at Speed
customer_reviews.text: I use the machine for filing labels, straight from my computer, it is fast and efficient. The labels are easy to install, there is a large selection of possible labels. I can’t fault it.
customer_reviews.author: F Reddington

customer_reviews.title: Okay. Printing is ALWAYS a pain.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job, but it is a pain to print either because paper is not correct, or you need to change the settings, or because the software doesn't recognize the right material (paper or monochrome/red)
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: huge range of labels
customer_reviews.text: Amazed at the range of label templates eg mini calendar, signs as well as the usual address labels and file labels. I was able to setup the printer and print off some labels within 30 mins. Easy to change the rolls of labels to a different size
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Ease to use
customer_reviews.text: The size is amazing, the software is quite ease to install. setting it up can be a bit of a challenge, but once done its great.
customer_reviews.author: BRYAN R PEROLLS

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant and very useful
customer_reviews.text: Item great. Good service from seller. Easy to install. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M k kaur

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this label printer less then 2 weeks ago. Was working perfect started making a weird noise and not printing properly. Now wont even turn on let alone do its job. I'm disabled and being told to make my way to a post office before I get a refund. I am house bound!!!. This is disgraceful.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: The quickest printer ever! Perfect for sellers too
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up in minutes! Perfect too if you want to automate a few of your selling processes, it comes with a software kit online which is great for FBA
customer_reviews.author: I tell the truth

customer_reviews.title: Thermal Printer, no need for ink!
customer_reviews.text: This a thermal printer, so no need for ink. The printer basically plug and play, so easy to setup. A must for those mailing lists, especially at Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Iain

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer and it did not work. The customer support was rude and useless stating that because I had bought it and installed the software they could not accept a return. My IT staff tried for a total of 4 hours to understand how to use it but as they had ZERO help from Brother they could not solve the issues.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Farmer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. It is easy to set up but not very easy with p touch. You may get used to work with soft ware after awhile then you are able to make lots of different labels. Sizing is a little bit tricky too. But overall very good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ata

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this Label maker. Better quality than my prevous Brother QL-570, but slightly bigger size. Like it!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Worked out of the box. The software vaguely works ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked out of the box. The software vaguely works on a Win10 tablet using touch, but really you need a mouse to access all the features
customer_reviews.author: TheST

customer_reviews.title: Brother QL 700 label printer unit
customer_reviews.text: I use a Mac and so wasnt the most easy item to set up... Having set the unit up the labels it prints are clear and self adhesive.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: very fast printing.
customer_reviews.text: Took me a while to set it up wirelessly with my laptops but once I had achieved that it works like a dream. Would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. M. Hawker

customer_reviews.title: One of the hardest bits of hardware I’ve tried to use
customer_reviews.text: If you have a spare 10 hours then go head and buy this. If you simply want a printer that you connect to your pc, upload a file and print labels (as per the description of the product) then spend the £50 on pen and paper and write out labels
customer_reviews.author: S. Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant little printer.
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly fast label printer that does not require ink !
customer_reviews.author: Sean J.

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: Found a little fiddly to start with but once I got the hang of it was glad we had it as made labels professionally
customer_reviews.author: nicola c Jackson

customer_reviews.title: price
customer_reviews.text: it was easy to operate and the quality of the print was fine. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: aidan callaghan

customer_reviews.title: works good
customer_reviews.text: software hard to get old of now but once its installed it works ok
customer_reviews.author: J,B,C

customer_reviews.title: Solid and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Printer is used daily, and works time after time; with good quality print every time. Fast too.
customer_reviews.author: Carlo Miller

customer_reviews.title: Very fast label printing
customer_reviews.text: Very fast label printing and cutting. All good so far.
customer_reviews.author: R B HUNTER

customer_reviews.title: Brother QL700 label printer
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely ideal for small shop use. Easy to use and set up and wouldn’t want to be within one.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Kelson

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase, have been using it for quite a while now and no problem at all.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine, prints very clear labels and is so easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Produces good tickets, painful to set up.
customer_reviews.text: The QL 700 was difficult to set up as stated by others, once it linked with the laptop the ticket result are quick to print, and just what we needed to get our Crackerdash product to market.
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: Best wee address and label printer
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and very easy to use you can print large labels and small labels great wee machine

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value for money
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup SMS to used gourd quality prints

customer_reviews.title: Too old to work in 2018
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work at all with Windows 10, tried numerous help videos and solutions. Downloaded loads of driver's and software. My computer still can't see the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our business a few months ago and tried to set it up this week. Unfortunately having spent many hours on trying to set this up which has been very frustrating we have now given up on getting it to work with our computers.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs B E Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Instant great results from an uncomplicated but capable bit of kit
customer_reviews.text: It is good. Very easy to get to know and use and is very fast. I like the fact that it will need no inks. Usefull for one off address labels or for printing address lists. Has other printing applications too

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: Works well with amazon scan & label for fba barcodes

customer_reviews.title: TO BE ABLE TO USE WIRELESSLY
customer_reviews.text: I CAN CONNECT AND WORK WITH PRINTER FROM MAINS, BUT WHEN I CONNECT TO LAPTOP COMPUTER IT WILL NOT SWITCH ON AT ALL. AND I WANT TO USE IT WIRELESS. PLEASE CAN YOU HELP. YOURS FAITHFULLY D CHETWYND. [MR]
customer_reviews.author: MR. D. Chetwynd

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: My new favourite thing! Great product, and the design spice is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Quick and speedy — read the instructions if you have a Mac
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly how you expect. Pretty quick and speedy. Read the instructions if you have a Mac or else you'll waste time trying to work out how to print with it.
customer_reviews.author: James Carruthers

customer_reviews.title: Brother Label Printer
customer_reviews.text: Very poor app for printing options not user friendly at all. The printer itself is good

customer_reviews.title: Easy to add your logo on to labels
customer_reviews.text: We use this to mark food items and ability to include our organisation logo on the label adds a bit of identity to our group.
customer_reviews.author: Smilinrik

product_meta.title: Brother QL-810W Label Maker, Wireless/USB 2.0, Address Label Printer, Desktop, Up to 62 mm Wide Labels, Red & Black Printing
product_meta.description:
Style Name:QL-810W| Pattern Name:Wifi/USB| Configuration:Red/Black Printing

This high-speed label printer connects to your PC, Mac, smartphone or tablet using USB or Wi-Fi. The built-in P-touch Editor Lite software is so easy to use - simply connect the printer to your computer, click the icon to launch the software and design and print your labels.

Thanks to its advanced print mechanism and special label roll, you can also print labels that can contain both black and red colours without the need for ink or toner.

And when you discover you can print custom sized labels up to one metre in length using the integrated cutter and continuous label rolls, it's easy to understand why the QL-810W is the ideal choice for offices, workgroups, mail rooms and receptions.



BOX CONTAINS


 * 1 x Brother QL-810W label printer 
 * 1 x UK 3-Pin AC adapter/power supply cable
 * 1 x USB cable
 * 1 x Software disc
 * 1 x Quick setup guide
 * 1 x Warranty card
 * 2 x Inbox rolls: 29 mm x 90 mm standard address labels (100 labels) and red/black 62 mm continuous length paper tape (5 metres)
feature_bullets: USB AND WI-FI CONNECTIVITY: Make light work of batch labelling jobs with the ability to connect to a smartphone, tablet, PC or Mac and print data from an MS Excel or Word document
CUSTOM LENGTH LABELS: Rolls are available in a range of traditional die-cut labels, or continuous length that lets the built-in cutter cut your label to your desired length
PERFECT FOR OFFICE LABELLING: Design and print fully customised labels containing text, frames, logos, barcodes and images for a professional finish
PRINT BLACK AND RED: Without the need for ink - ideal to highlight important information on a label
PLUG AND PLAY: With P-touch editor software pre-loaded to the printer, set up is quick and easy. Plus with easy to install label rolls and a built-in automatic label cutter, labelling is hassle free

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars731 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
